items.title: BBC News app
items.summary: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

items.title: Meet the history-making astronauts headed for the Moon
items.summary: Astronauts of Nasa's first crewed mission to the Moon for more than 50 years hope their journey inspires a new generation.

items.title: 'Film me all you want' - teenage girls with no fear of police torment one High Street
items.summary: Teenagers have been targeting shops in Shirley, Hampshire, with antisocial behaviour - leaving the owners feeling "helpless".

items.title: Delhi’s self-styled godman Chaitanyananda Saraswati held in Agra
items.summary: Earlier, police froze ₹8 crore linked to Saraswati and parked in multiple bank accounts and fixed deposits

items.title: Trump says he will send troops to Portland, Oregon, in latest deployment to U.S. cities
items.summary: Mr. Trump said the decision was necessary to protect U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement facilities, which he alleged is "under siege from attack by Antifa, and other domestic terrorists"

items.title: Trump to meet with top four congressional leaders as government shutdown risk looms
items.summary: The meeting, to be held on September 29, involves House Speaker Mike Johnson and Senate Majority Leader John Thune as well as House Democratic leader Hakeem Jeffries and Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer

items.title: Morning Digest: At least 39 dead in stampede at actor Vijay’s rally in Karur; no contact with Sonam Wangchuk, no detention order shared, says his wife, and more
items.summary: Here is a select list of stories to start the day.

items.title: Dugong redux
items.summary: A multi-stakeholder conservation project in the waters of the Palk Bay has resulted in a rise in the number of dugongs, once dwindling in the area. S. Ganesan and R. Rajaram examine what measures facilitated the return of these sea cows, and what more needs to be done, even as international recognit

items.title: Awareness meet at Anna Nagar Tower Park as culmination of a study on drug use among undergraduate students
items.summary: MSSW postgraduate students have carried out research that dealt with the various issues connected with drug use, including peer pressure and the social stigma that discourages  students from seeking de-addiction support

items.title: In Kolkata, poetry and art from Gaza and Bengal famine converge in Durga Puja pandal
items.summary: Artist Pradip Das explores parallels between poems from the Gaza strip and the depictions of hunger and death in Bengali poetry on the famine; they are connected, despite being several kilometres and years apart, he says

items.title: Health Minister orders transfer of Chief Medical Officer
Youth found dead, police suspect murder
Man arrested for pledging rented car in Tiruvottiyur
Elephants in fragmented habitats of South Bengal record higher levels of stress, reveals study
items.summary: Elephants living in more fragmented habitats in central India, particularly South Bengal have recorded higher adrenal activity to cope with the stress.

items.title: The invisibilised workforce behind Durga Puja festivities
items.summary: The people who sacrifice festive joy to keep Kolkata’s grandest celebration running

items.title: Vote Chori: Opposition MPs should resign and not legitimise the actions of BJP: Parakala Prabhakar
Karur TVK secretary booked over stampede at Vijay’s rally
items.summary: Police said the case was filed under sections 109, 110, 125b, 223 of BNS for alleged violation of norms during the campaign event at Velysamupuram.

items.title: The crucial issue behind Wangchuk’s detention is whether his acts prejudiced ‘public order’
items.summary: The Supreme Court has differentiated between breach of ‘law and order’ and violation of ‘public order’; the latter refers to actions which affect the community or the public at large

items.title: What does Trump’s latest H-1B directive state? | Explained
items.summary: What will be the consequences for both American and immigrant workers? Do overseas workers displace Americans in tech jobs? What do surveys show? What are immigration lawyers saying? What are the trends likely to play out in the tech sector?

items.title: How Israel used Azure to monitor Palestinians | Explained
items.summary: What did Microsoft do after an investigation revealed that Israel’s spy unit was using its surveillance software to gather information from Gaza and the West Bank? When did Unit 8200 begin the collaboration with Microsoft engineers? Aren’t Palestinian networks independent?

items.title: Attempt to close down puja pandal on Operation Sindoor theme: BJP leader; Kolkata police deny charge
items.summary: Organisers of Durga Puja pandal at Santosh Mitra Square in Kolkata claim efforts by police to stop the light and sound show based on Operation Sindoor; police only concerned with public safety as large crowd has been gathering in a narrow space: Kolkata Police Commissioner

items.title: Why is Ladakh’s tribal population restive? | Explained
items.summary: What led to the violence? What are the protesters’ demands? Why has activist Sonam Wangchuk been arrested?

items.title: Over 300 delegates from across T.N. attend oncology conference
Madras Medical Mission marks World Heart Day with community outreach
GCTP adopt live monitoring system to streamline traffic management in city
items.summary: The live traffic monitor helps the Greater Chennai Traffic Police to simultaneously monitor all 270 junctions in the city, covering around 1,000 roads; it helps them stay informed about real-time traffic conditions, including congestion and incidents, and take quick decisions

Armstrong in July 2024, apart from attempted murder and extortion cases

items.title: Acetaminophen | Spectacle of blame
items.summary: Scientists and obstetric groups have objected Trump administration’s claims that the drug ‘causes’ autism when used during pregnancy

items.title: Palaniswami urges Chief Minister M.K. Stalin to release white paper on T.N.’s financial position

items.title: Watch: Vijay’s Karur rally turns deadly: 36 killed in stampede, probe ordered
items.summary: A tragic stampede at actor-politician Vijay’s rally in Karur claimed at least 36 lives, including women and children, and left over 50 injured. The overcrowded event was part of Vijay’s state-wide tour. CM M.K. Stalin called the incident deeply concerning, ordered emergency response, and announced ₹

items.title: M.S. Swaminathan spoke on climate change 50 years ago, says Stalin
items.summary: At the Centenary Tribute event for the scientist, the Chief Minister hails him as a guardian of food security who worked towards poverty eradication

items.title: Mohanlal | The legend next door
items.summary: The veteran actor, who won the prestigious Dadasaheb Phalke award, redefined stardom in the Malayalam film industry and steered a new path in cinema by combining commercial elements with unique story-telling perspectives

items.title: DMK refutes Vijay’s claim on memorial for Subbarayan

items.summary: Paddy fields are thriving in a quiet part of east England and might help feed us in the future.

items.title: Karur stampede: Anatomy of the tragedy at Vijay’s TVK rally in Tamil Nadu
items.summary: The organisers had announced that TVK president Vijay would speak at 12 p.m.; the crowd began to assemble from 9 a.m., but he did not arrive at the scheduled time.

items.summary: A review meeting convened by Industries Minister P. Rajeeve resolved to initiate tender formalities promptly upon receipt of technical sanction

items.title: Move over, Murdochs - a new family dynasty is shaking up US media
items.summary: Larry Ellison's relationship with Donald Trump has drawn scrutiny as the tech billionaire and his son strive to become major media moguls.

items.title: Have these two scientists found the answer to stop shoes stinking?
items.summary: Two Indian researchers have designed a shoe rack that banishes foul odours - and have won a fun science prize.

items.summary: Europe's 6-2 demolition job of the US to take an 11½-4½ lead into the singles has seemingly made Sunday a formality.

items.title: Bison caught in residential area released into Aralam sanctuary

items.summary: Ukraine said an overnight Russian barrage killed one person and wounded 12 in the southeastern Kherson region, and damaged railways in the neighboring Odesa region

items.summary: Tensions between the two countries have increased after the US Navy targeted boats off the coast of Venezuela.

items.summary: The build-up to Labour's big meeting this week and England's Rugby World Cup glory dominate Sunday's papers.

items.summary: Officials of State Highways, which is constructing the bridge, said that most of the encroachments are houses and petty shops, which were built more than two decades ago.

items.summary: Anthony McGill will play Shaun Murphy in the final of the British Open after winning four consecutive frames to beat compatriot John Higgins.

items.summary: The BRICS statement notes “serious concerns about the rise of unilateral tariff and non-tariff measures which distort trade and are inconsistent with WTO rules”.

items.title: Pheasant-tailed jacana: raising more families
items.summary: The Pheasant-tailed jacana which depends on the monsoons and availability of water to breed can now be seen wearing its breeding plumage more frequently, sometimes as early as mid-April and that should not raise eyebrows

items.title: Maulana forgot whose government is in Uttar Pradesh, will teach a lesson generations will forget to riot, says Adityanath
items.summary: A day after a demonstration on a cleric’s call took a violent turn leading to clashes with the police, the Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister says “for such anti-social elements” who were getting a free run, “we have brought in the bulldozer”.
